scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. During a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You suggested taking a pause to rethink the approach. With the team gathered again, [Monica] leaned back in her chair, crossing her arms, and said, 'So, what’s the new grand plan?' You invited collaborative problem-solving by suggesting, 'Let's brainstorm some ideas together. We need everyone's input to come up with a viable plan.' [Monica] rolled her eyes and said, 'Brainstorming isn’t going to magically give us more hours in the day.' [Bob] added, 'I mean, if we’re going to do this, we need concrete steps, not just ideas.' You proposed a practical step to address the workload by saying, 'Let's start by listing out the specific tasks and see which ones we can delegate or simplify.'
scenes.description: [Monica] sighs deeply and throws her hands up, 'Fine, but this better work.' [Bob] looks at you and says, 'Alright, what’s the first step then?'

options.text: Let's break this down by team member strengths and see who can take on which tasks efficiently.
options.analysis: You suggested leveraging team member strengths to optimize task delegation, showing good emotional perception and empathy.

options.text: We should probably re-evaluate the timeline and see if we can get any extensions on less critical tasks.
options.analysis: You suggested re-evaluating the timeline and seeking extensions, demonstrating good self-regulation and motivation.

options.text: Let’s focus on what’s within our control. We’ve overcome harder challenges before.
options.analysis: You emphasized focusing on controllable factors and past successes, showing high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
